intro: Sida ultima, commonly known as the redroot sida, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and parts of Mexico. It is a low-growing annual herb that typically reaches heights of 10 to 30 centimeters. The plant features alternate, ovate leaves with hairy surfaces and produces small, pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters. Its fruit is a capsule that contains numerous tiny seeds. Sida ultima is often found in disturbed soils and is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural settings.
